channel.title: Environmental variables?
channel.description: i remember a guide on how to get silab client to work on a vista, saying i need to set my environmental variables..? how do i do this?

item.title: Environmental variables?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Your problem is that you don’t have the MoparScape client cache. To run this client, that is what you need. Download it here.

item.title: Environmental variables?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You really only need to set the path variable, but you can set classpath if you wish to (you will probably just end up overwriting it as a jvm flag anyways.) To do this, right click on My Computer and click Properties (or hit windows key + pause break, whatever works best for you.) From there, click on “Change Settings” that has the little Windows Security symbol next to it. You will now be at a dialog box named “System Properties” that has five unique tabs. Go into the advanced tab. Now, the lowest button in the internal pane of the dialog is called “Environmental Variables”, click it. In the new window that showed up, find the ‘path’ variable and click ‘edit’. Append the following to the beginning of the “value” line:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin";

Now click OK, OK, and OK. Boom, you have your path variable set and you can use any jdk bin files as a normal batch command.

Read full topic
